headerDisplay: This plugin is currently experimental and under development.  Please report [bugs](https://github.com/kovapatrik/homebridge-midea-platform/issues)

refreshInterval.title: Interval, in seconds, to query Midea devices for state
refreshInterval.description: Frequency that the plugin will query devices for their current state (temperature, humidity, etc.). Some Midea devices update the plugin automatically on any change, others require that the device is queried. The default is 30 seconds, the maximum is 86400 (24 hours). Setting value to 0 (zero) disables polling and updates will only be noted if devices sends it automatically.

heartbeatInterval.title: Interval, in seconds, to send keep-alive message to Midea devices
heartbeatInterval.description: Frequency that the plugin sends a message to Midea devices to keep the network socket open. The default and minimum is 10 seconds, you can increase this up to a maximum of 120 (2 minutes). If you see socket closed messages in the log reduce this value.

uiDebug.title: Enable debug for the custom UI (including device discovery)
uiDebug.description: Debug data for the custom UI device discovery process will be logged to the Homebridge log and Javascript console.

type.title: Device Type
type.description: Select the type of device you are adding.

name.title: Device Name
name.description: This replaces the name provided by the Midea device.

id.title: Device Identifier
id.description: The ID of the device. This shouldn't be changed if it was added by discovery.

ip.title: IP Address
ip.description: IP address of device on your local LAN. This is optional and shouldn't be changed if it was added by discovery.

token.title: Device login token
token.description: Token of the device obtained from cloud. This shouldn't be changed if it was added by discovery.

key.title: Device login key
key.description: Key of the device obtained from cloud. This shouldn't be changed if it was added by discovery.

verbose.title: Enable verbose logging
verbose.description: Enables additional debug logging that may help a developer identify problems when working on Midea device support. Homebridge must be running with debug enabled for any debug logging to be visible.

logRecoverableErrors.title: Log recoverable errors
logRecoverableErrors.description: If you see frequent warning or error messages in the log that the plugin recovers from you can suppress these messages by disabling this setting.

logRefreshStatusErrors.title: Log refresh status errors
logRefreshStatusErrors.description: If you see warning and errors which are related to the refresh status process you can suppress these messages by disabling this setting. (e.g.: `Does not supports the protocol...`)

temperatureSensor.title: Temperature Sensor
temperatureSensor.description: Toggles if the temperature sensor is created with the accessory.

fanAccessory.title: Fan Accessory
fanAccessory.description: Toggles if the fan accessory is created with the accessory.

humiditySensor.title: Humidity Sensor
humiditySensor.description: Toggles if a seperated humidity sensor is created with the accessory. This sensor can be used for autmations as for some reason the internal humidity sensor is not usable for this.

pumpSwitch.title: Pump Switch
pumpSwitch.description: Toggles if the pump switch is created with the accessory.

waterTankSensor.title: Water Tank Sensor
waterTankSensor.description: Creates a water tank sensor accessory which can be used to trigger automations when the tank is full. The sensor will show as `Leak Sensor` or `Contact Sensor` depending on this setting.

humidityOffset.title: Humidity Offset
humidityOffset.description: Offset for the humidity sensor. This is useful if the humidity sensor is not accurate or if you want to adjust the humidity value.

mode.title: Swing Mode
mode.description: Set swing mode of the unit. If your unit does not support this feature then leave it on None.

angleAccessory.title: Swing Angle Accessory
angleAccessory.description: Toggles if the swing angle accessory is created with the accessory. The accessory can be used to set the angle of the slat to a specified value. The `mode` property will be used to determine the direction of the slat. The main position bar will be used to set the angle of the direction which is selected in the `mode` property.

angleMainControl.title: Swing Angle Main Control
angleMainControl.description: If `mode` property is Both and the swing angle accessory is enabled, this property will be used to determine which direction will be controlled by the main position bar of the accessory.

heatingCapable.title: Heating Capability
heatingCapable.description: Toggles if heating is enabled on the accessory. If your unit does not support heating then leave this off.

outDoorTemp.title: Outdoor Temperature
outDoorTemp.description: Toggles if the outdoor temperature is created with the accessory.

audioFeedback.title: Audio Feedback
audioFeedback.description: Toggles if the unit beeps when a command is sent.

screenOff.title: Diplay screen off by default
screenOff.description: Toggles if the screen is turned off by default when the unit is turned on.

flag.description: Toggles if a switch, which can turn the display on or off will be created or not.

command.title: Display Switch Alternate Command
command.description: Use this if the switch display command does not work. If it doesn't work either way then you unit does not support this feature.

auxHeatingSwitches.title: Auxiliary Heating Switches
auxHeatingSwitches.description: Toggles if the aux and aux+heat switches are created with the accessory.
